alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 31 at 5:35PM EDT until March 31 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in Water across Churchill Street in Dushore due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Dushore and Laporte are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall of 0.2 to 0.5 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laporte, Lincoln Falls, Muncy Valley, Kettle Creek Gorge, Dushore, Forksville, Eagles Mere and Hillsgrove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
